Often times the CPU usage is in the high 100s or mid 200s (see screenshots below). Has anyone encountered this as well? If so, are there any strategies or options within the IDE to correct this intensive use of system resources?

items.title: Entity Framework 6 - fill property from another table
items.body:
I have a working project with an existing Database, models, and everything. I'm thinking of using EF6, but at the same time I'd like to keep the control. And my problem is, I cannot solve the following problem. I have these two models:

public class CMaster
{
    public int Id { get; set; }
    public string Title { get; set; }
    public int DetailId { get; set; }
    public string DetailName { get; set; }
}
public class CDetail
{
    public int Id { get; set; }
    public string Title { get; set; }
}

Up till now I had a query, like this:

SELECT 
    m.ID,
    m.TITLE,
    m.IDDETAIL DetailId,
    (SELECT d.TITLE FROM DETAIL d 
WHERE d.ID = m.IDDETAIL) DetailName
FROM MASTER m

with this query I had one database run to query the Master, AND to query ONLY ONE record from the Detail table, that belongs to this Master.

I'm using Fluent API, and I've set things like:

public class CMasterDetailsContext : DbContext
{
    public CMasterDetailsContext(DbConnection existingConnection) : base(existingConnection, contextOwnsConnection: false)
    {

    }

    protected override void OnModelCreating(DbModelBuilder modelBuilder)
    {
        modelBuilder.HasDefaultSchema("MYSCHEMA");

        modelBuilder.Entity<CMaster>().ToTable("MASTER");
        modelBuilder.Entity<CMaster>().HasKey(m => m.Id);
        modelBuilder.Entity<CMaster>().Property(m => m.Id).HasColumnName("ID");
        modelBuilder.Entity<CMaster>().Property(m => m.Title).HasColumnName("TITLE");
        modelBuilder.Entity<CMaster>().Property(m => m.DetailId).HasColumnName("IDDETAIL");
        modelBuilder.Entity<CMaster>().Ignore(m => m.DetailName);


        modelBuilder.Entity<CDetail>().ToTable("DETAIL");
        modelBuilder.Entity<CDetail>().HasKey(d => d.Id);
        modelBuilder.Entity<CDetail>().Property(d => d.Id).HasColumnName("ID");
        modelBuilder.Entity<CDetail>().Property(d => d.Title).HasColumnName("TITLE");

        base.OnModelCreating(modelBuilder);
    }

    public DbSet<CMaster> MasterEntries { get; set; }
    public DbSet<CDetail> DetailEntries { get; set; }
}

I thought I should be able to map one property (Title) of my Detail table to one property (DetailName) of the Master table here in the OnModelCreating method. I found HasComputedColumnSql, but it exists only in EF Core.

Then I tried it like:

var oMasterEntriesFromLinqJoin = Enumerable.Join(oContext.MasterEntries, oContext.DetailEntries, m => m.DetailId, d => d.Id, (master, detail) =>
{
    master.DetailName = detail.Title;
    return master;
});

But in this case EF loads the entire Details table, then makes the join. That means two database runs, and in the first one the entire Details table will be loaded, what I want to avoid. Is there any (elegant) solution?

items.title: How to resolve parseError REST response from Google Calendar API
items.body:
I am trying to send a POST request to the Google Calendar API using the Delphi REST controls.
This is the data I am trying to send a jsonObject:

jsonObjEventResource := '{"summary":"test","description":"testing","id":"06824945162f4204bfdc041ae1bbae85","start":{"date":"2018-04-18"},"end":{"date":"2018-04-18"},"guestsCanInviteOthers":false,"visibility":"private"}';

RESTRequest.Method := TRESTRequestMethod.rmPOST;
RESTRequest.Body.ClearBody;
RESTRequest.Body.Add(jsonObjEventResource,ctAPPLICATION_JSON);
RESTRequest.Execute;

I do have access to the GET methods but I am unable to POST.
This is my URI: https://www.googleapis.com/calendar/v3/calendars/primary/events?access_token={access_token}.
My scope is : https://www.googleapis.com/auth/calendar;
Is there any way to resolve the parseError reponse from Google? I saw other people have the same error with the client libraries but those work arounds don't work for me.

The error message:

            {

I need to get build name for particular _id value. For sample above is clone-MavenEx without anything else. The _id value I got previously using JSON Extractor.

I used the following Groovy code in JSR223 Post Processor 

import org.apache.jmeter.samplers.SampleResult; 
import groovy.json.JsonSlurper;

String jsonString = prev.getResponseDataAsString();
String projectID = vars.get("project_id");

def slurper = new JsonSlurper();
def result  = slurper.parseText(jsonString);
def index   = result.find { it._id == projectID };

if ( index == null ) {
    vars.put( "buildName", 'NOTFOUND' );
} else {
    vars.put( "buildName", index.builds.toString() );
}

items.title: Skip Global Middleware for specific Rout in Laravel 5.3
items.body:
I created one global Middleware and it works perfectly fine for all the Routs but now i need to skip one Rout from that Middleware Following is My MIddleware and Routs and Kernal.php file

MIddleware:Check shop

<?php
namespace App\Http\Middleware;
use Closure;
class Checkshop
{
/**
 * Handle an incoming request.
 *
 * @param  \Illuminate\Http\Request  $request
 * @param  \Closure  $next
 * @return mixed
 */
public function handle($request, Closure $next)
{   
    if(session('shop'))
        {
            $shop = session('shop');
        }
    else{
            if($request['shop'])
            {
                session(['shop' => $request['shop']]);
                $shop = session('shop');
            }
            else{
                dd('session expiere');
            }

        }

    return $next($request);
 }

items.body_markdown:
In my application I would like to execute the query (which, as a .sql script, works correctly):

    SELECT jobs.job_title, employees.last_name, job_history.start_date, job_history.end_date
    FROM jobs
    JOIN job_history
        ON jobs.job_id = job_history.job_id
    JOIN employees
        ON job_history.employee_id = employees.employee_id;
After executing above query I receive: "illegal attempt to dereference collection". I searched for some answers, which may help to overcome it and tried to reproduce them to my case in that way (a little bit simplier query):

    SELECT jh.start_date, jh.end_date, j.job_title
    FROM job_history jh
    JOIN jh.job j
    WHERE j.job_title != 'a' -- or any other always fulfilled statement;
but I receive "could not execute the query". The objects `job` and `employee` are mapped in class JobHistory using `@ManyToOne(fetch=FetchType.EAGER)` and `@JoinColumn(name="(...)")` and `@OneToMany(mappedBy = "(...)")` in the corresponding classes. Could you tell me how should I build the (EDIT: first) query?

items.title: integrate jQuery object in angular 5
items.body:
i'm working with angular 5, and tried to make a multiple range slider.
hopefully, i found the Elessar plugin, that do exactly what i need, but doesn't have an angular version (there is angularJs but angular 5 is needed in my case).
it also requires jQuery, and Estira, and after a hard 12 hours, i made it work, to create the jQuery object that will hold the range slider, like the above example (here is the source code)

the $.prepend() function, add the jquery object to it's container, but the dragging and sliding effects and all other events are unreached.
in other words, the jquery is presented, as a plain HTML, without event listeners, that handles the range slider.

import { Component, OnInit, AfterViewInit, Renderer2, ViewChild, NgZone } from '@angular/core';
declare var jquery: any, $: any;
declare var require: any;
import 'estira/index.js';
import 'elessar/dist/elessar.js';

declare var System: any;


@Component({
  selector: 'fuse-branch-timesheet-form',
  templateUrl: './branch-timesheet-form.component.html',
  styleUrls: ['./branch-timesheet-form.component.scss'],

})
export class BranchTimesheetFormComponent implements OnInit, AfterViewInit {

  r: any;
  @ViewChild('myButton') myButton;



  constructor(private renderer: Renderer2, private zone: NgZone) {}

  ngOnInit() {}

  ngAfterViewInit() {
    System.import('elessar/dist/elessar.js').then(RangeBar => {
      $('#dds').prepend(RangeBar({
        min: 0,
        max: 100,
        values: [
          [5,30],
          [50,70],
        ],
        label: function(a){return JSON.stringify(a); },
        snap: 1,
        minSize: 10,
        bgLabels: 4,
      }).on('changing', function(ev, ranges, changed) {
        console.log(changed);
        $('pre.changing').html(JSON.stringify(ranges, null, 2));
      }).on('change', function(ev, ranges, changed) {
        console.log(changed);
        $('pre.changing').after($('<pre>').html('changed' + JSON.stringify(ranges, null, 2)));
      }).$el);

      console.log(this.r);

    });
}



}

my question is, how to integrate a jquery object in a component, with garding, all the events on it, like in the demo.

i will be grateful, if anyone, could show an example in plnkr or stackblitz.

thank you.

items.title: Multiple parameters in a json file
items.body:
I have a problem in a JSON file. I have a lot of if-else-if conditions in main.cpp file and each condition has a variable. In my JSON file, I want to input values for two variables, but I do not know how.

For example:

else if (mCell == ForthCellwithnoGate)
{
   mConditionCollection["many crowd"] = (double)(MaxCapacity5 - mcap5) / (MaxCapacity5);
}

ForthCellwithnoGate and mcap5 are variables that might have value taken from the input file. Has anyone any ideas?

Thanks in advance!

items.body:
I've read thru the other threads and tried to return something to my cloud functions, but it still gives the same Function returned undefined, expected Promise or value warning... What am I missing here?

Basically, I'm sending two emails out using mailgun-js to the user and to the admin, even though the sending is successful and stuff, I still get the same warning in my logs.

exports.sendSample = functions.database
.ref( 'sample/{pushID}' )
.onWrite( event => {

    //  only trigger if it's new
    if ( !event.data.exists() || event.data.previous.exists() ) return 0

    const e = event.data.val()

    const toUser = {
        to      : `${ e.email }`,
        from    : `xxx`,
        subject : `xxx`,
        html    : `xxx`
    }

    const toAdmin = {
        to      : `${ e.admin }`,
        from    : `xxx`,
        subject : `xxx`,
        html    : `xxx`
    }

    //  send sms
    if ( e.mobile !== 'none' ) {
        return client.messages.create({
            body : `xxx`,
            to   : `${e.mobile}`,
            from : `xxx`
        })
        .then( message => {
            sendEmail()
            return message.sid
        })
        .catch( err => {
            return err
        })
    } else {
        sendEmail()
    }

    //  send email
    function sendEmail() {
        if ( e.email !== 'none' ) {
            return mailgun.messages().send( toUser, ( err, body ) => {
                return ( err, body )
                return mailgun.messages().send( toAdmin, ( err, body ) => {
                    return ( err, body )
                })
            })
        } else {
            return true
        }
    }
})
